result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea Marie McLaughlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrea Marie McLaughlin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrea Marie McLaughlin was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrea Marie McLaughlin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA & SCSO. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay $25/mo comm 3-25-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Andrea Marie McLaughlin appeared. Case called at 11:08. Atty. Kucinski updates the court. ADA Hartung agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 2 in 16CM05. DE sworn. Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 16CM05. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in16CM05. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.


DE to meet with the payment clerk.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Andrea Marie McLaughlin appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 11:15 am.
